{"step_by_step_thinking": "CPCR stands for Cardiopulmonary Cerebral Resuscitation. According to the American Heart Association (AHA) 2010 Guidelines, Adrenalin (Epinephrine) and Amiodarone are recommended for use in cardiac arrest. Vasopressin was also used as an alternative to epinephrine in cardiac arrest, but it was removed from the guidelines in 2010. Atropine was recommended for use in bradycardia and not in cardiac arrest, and it was removed from the cardiac arrest algorithm in the 2010 AHA Guidelines.", "answer_choice": "C. Atropine"}
